comment.author: 22915643@N07
comment._content: Guessing these are the Most Rev. John M Farley, Archbishop of New York, and the Most Rev. William H. O'Connell, Archbishop of Boston, who were named Cardinals on October 28, 1911 (according to article in New York Times of Oct 29).

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: Thanks for the information. We'll look into it.

comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: John Cardinal Murphy Farley (April 20, 1842 - September 17, 1918) was an Irish-American prelate, the seventh bishop (fourth archbishop) of the Roman Catholic diocese of New York. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Murphy_Farley William Henry Cardinal O'Connell (December 8, 1859 – April 22, 1944) was Archbishop of the Roman Catholic Church who became the first leader of the Archdiocese of Boston to be named a Cardinal of the Catholic Church. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Henry_O'Connell
